answers.answer: Hi.Ductal Carcinoma In-Situ (DCIS) is not an invasive type of cancer and is confined to the duct of the breast.  It can, however, grow in size.Considering the age of your mother, as well as possible comorbid conditions like hypertension and diabetes, and her present functional status, careful discussion on the risks and benefits of treatment should be undertaken.It would be best to discuss these issues to your mother's doctors.Good luck.

question: My 91 year old mother has just been diagnosed with DCIS, grade low. We are reluctant for her to undergo either a mastectomy or breast conserving surgery due to her age and a recent CT scan showing multiple small strokes. The diagnosis was made through mammogram and biopsy. Does DCIS typically spread rapidly to become invasive cancer or is it generally slow moving?
title: 91 yr old woman with DCIS
